arts.ttl: Leeds should sign David Brooks after McAtee blow
arts.sum: Leeds United were looking to sign James McAtee from Manchester City, but Pep Guardiola ruled out any chance of that in the near future with his recent comments. Leeds tried for James McAtee, Man City and Pep Guardiola blocked any attempts

arts.ttl: Daniel Farke press conference LIVE as Leeds United boss reacts to dominant Coventry win
arts.sum: Daniel Farke's Leeds United press conference is taking place at Elland Road after today's clash with Coventry City. Pascal Struijk missed a lot of training this week and was rated as a doubt by the manager, but he recovered to retain his place in central defence.

arts.ttl: Mark Robins makes mentality admission after 'poor' Coventry City performance at Leeds United
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. It was really disappointing, so we have got to try to turn that around, turn the performance around and the mentality around on Tuesday, because we were poor today.”

arts.ttl: Mark Robins' Leeds United comments after Coventry City loss will delight Elland Road diehards
arts.sum: Coventry City manager Mark Robins has tipped Leeds United to be "there or thereabouts" in the Championship promotion shake-up this season. Robins said: "Leeds have sold over £100m worth of talent this summer and replaced them with good quality as well.

arts.ttl: What Leeds United boss Daniel Farke said on Coventry City victory and Ethan Ampadu's knee injury
arts.sum: Boss Daniel Farke hailed his Leeds United side following their "mature" performance at home to Coventry City. Farke, who confirmed captain Ethan Ampadu was forced off with a knee injury and will be assessed over the coming days, said: "(We) controlled everything off the ball, but decisions in passing were not that great.

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings as Sky Blues bystanders against slick-looking Leeds United - Andy Turner
arts.sum: That finally came early after the break when Ben Sheaf attempted a shot, albeit flying high and wide of the goal, but Daniel Farke’s men picked City off in the 49th minute when full-back Jaydon Bogle played a one-two down the right and fired in off the keeper, who got a touch but couldn’t stop it hitting the back of the net. Mark Robins threw on Haji Wright, Tatsuhiro Sakamoto and Brandon Thomas-Asante just after the hour but the Sky Blues were chasing the game and Leeds were content to sit back, soak up any pressure and hit City on the counter attack, knowing that the three points were in the bag.

arts.ttl: Leeds United player ratings with Gnonto and Ramazani superb in Coventry win
arts.sum: The second goal came early in the second half with Largie Ramazani feeding Jayden Bogle for his maiden Leeds strike. No goal or assist, but Aaronson had a really good all-round performance.

arts.ttl: Leeds brush past Coventry to maintain impressive early form
arts.sum: The away side are struggling so far this campaign.

arts.ttl: Leeds United suffer new injury scare during Championship clash with Coventry City
arts.sum: Leeds United starting XI: Illan Meslier; Jayden Bogle, Joe Rodon, Pascal Struijk, Junior Firpo; Ethan Ampadu, Ilia Gruev; Wilfried Gnonto, Brenden Aaronson, Largie Ramazani; Mateo Joseph.
